etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Harper's Magazine. From photo- + visual

definitions: Designating or relating to a lens or optical instrument that brings to the same focus both visible light and light that can only be detected photographically (usually ultraviolet). Also as noun: such a lens or telescope.
Designating a stellar magnitude determined in terms of the spectral response of the eye by photographically mimicking this response using colour filters.
